night_horizons.transformers.order module¶

Module for transforming the data by ordering it.

class night_horizons.transformers.order.OrderTransformer(order_columns: list, apply: bool = True, ascending: bool = True)¶

Bases: TransformerMixin, BaseEstimator

fit(X: DataFrame, y=None) → OrderTransformer¶

Fitting is a no-op, i.e. nothing is done.

Parameters¶

Xpd.DataFrame

The input data to fit the transformer on.

yNone, optional

The target variable. This parameter is ignored in this method.

Returns¶

OrderTransformer

The fitted transformer instance.

transform(X: DataFrame) → DataFrame¶

Transforms the input DataFrame by sorting it based on the specified order columns.

Parameters¶

Xpd.DataFrame

The input DataFrame to be transformed.

Returns¶

pd.DataFrame

The transformed DataFrame with the specified order columns sorted, or just with an added “order” column if self.apply is False.

class night_horizons.transformers.order.SensorAndDistanceOrder(apply: bool = True, sensor_order_col: str = 'camera_num', sensor_order_map: dict = {0: 1, 1: 0, 2: 2}, coords_cols: list[str] = ['x_center', 'y_center'])¶

Bases: OrderTransformer

Simple estimator to implement ordering of data according to sensor and distance.

The center defaults to that of the first training sample.

fit(X: DataFrame, y=None) → SensorAndDistanceOrder¶

Fits the transformer to the input data, i.e. sets the center.

Parameters¶

Xpd.DataFrame

The input data to fit the transformer on.

yNone, optional

The target variable. This parameter is ignored.

Returns¶

SensorAndDistanceOrder

The fitted transformer object.

transform(X: DataFrame) → DataFrame¶

Transform the input DataFrame by adding additional columns, and then ordering by them.

Parameters¶

Xpd.DataFrame

The input DataFrame to be transformed.

Returns¶

pd.DataFrame

The transformed DataFrame.
